org.jetel.data

Class CircularBufferQueue

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jetel.data.CircularBufferQueue

  • public class CircularBufferQueue
extends java.lang.Object
    CircularBufferQueue is in-memory queue for data records. Only single-thread data records producer and single-thread data record consumer is supported.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static CloverBuffer EOF_CLOVER_BUFFER
      This instance of CloverBuffer is returned by poll(CloverBuffer) or blockingPoll(CloverBuffer) if EOF annotation is reached.
      static DataRecord EOF_DATA_RECORD
      This instance of DataRecord is returned by poll(DataRecord) or blockingPoll(DataRecord) if EOF annotation is reached.

    • Method Detail

      • offer

        public boolean offer(DataRecord dataRecord)
        Tries to write given data record into this queue.
        Parameters:
        dataRecord - written data record
        Returns:
        true if data record fits to the queue, false otherwise

      • offer

        public boolean offer(DataRecord dataRecord,
            int recordSize)
        Tries to write given data record into this queue. NOTE: this method is useful in case the size of serialised form of data record is already calculated.
        Parameters:
        dataRecord - written data record
        recordSize - size of serialised data record
        Returns:
        true if data record fits to the queue, false otherwise

      • offer

        public boolean offer(CloverBuffer cloverBuffer)
        Tries to write given clover buffer into this queue.
        Parameters:
        cloverBuffer - written data buffer
        Returns:
        true if buffer fits to the queue, false otherwise

      • poll

        public DataRecord poll(DataRecord record)
        Tries to read a data record from this queue.
        Parameters:
        record - read data record
        Returns:
        read data record or EOF_DATA_RECORD or null if no data record is available in this queue

      • poll

        public CloverBuffer poll(CloverBuffer buffer)
        Tries to read a CloverBuffer from this queue.
        Parameters:
        buffer - read CloverBuffer
        Returns:
        read CloverBuffer or EOF_CLOVER_BUFFER or null if no CloverBuffer is available in this queue

      • blockingPoll

        public DataRecord blockingPoll(DataRecord record)
                        throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        Reads a data record from this queue.
        Parameters:
        record - read data record
        Returns:
        read data record or EOF_DATA_RECORD
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException

      • blockingPoll

        public CloverBuffer blockingPoll(CloverBuffer buffer)
                          throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        Reads a CloverBuffer from this queue.
        Parameters:
        buffer - read CloverBuffer
        Returns:
        read CloverBuffer or EOF_CLOVER_BUFFER
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException

      • getReadOnlyInternalBuffer

        public CloverBuffer getReadOnlyInternalBuffer()
        Returns:
        read only view into internal data buffer

      • getInternalBuffer

        public CloverBuffer getInternalBuffer()
        This method publics internal data buffer. While the time is manipulated with the writingDataBuffer, no other action should performed on this CircularBufferQueue. Afterwards the internal buffer is updated by caller, clear() of flip() method has to be invoked. The buffer could be even expanded, so all internal states has to be reseted, for example capacity variable has to be updated.
        Returns:

      • clear

        public void clear()
        Resets all internal states of this queue. Queue is considered empty.

      • flip

        public void flip()
        This method should be invoked after internal buffer has been externally populated via getInternalBuffer(). Data written into writingDataBuffer are ready to read afterwards.

      • setBlocking

        public void setBlocking(boolean isBlocking)
        This method turns on/off blocking behaviour of methods blockingPoll(CloverBuffer) and blockingPoll(DataRecord). Already blocked reading thread is possibly woken up.
        Parameters:
        isBlocking -

      • getCapacity

        public int getCapacity()
        Returns:
        size of internal data buffer

      • hasData

        public boolean hasData()
        Returns:
        true if some data are ready to read

      • eof

        public boolean eof()
        Writes special annotation into internal data buffer, which is identified as end of stream. Read method poll(CloverBuffer) returns EOF_CLOVER_BUFFER if this annotation is reached while reading. Read method poll(DataRecord) returns EOF_DATA_RECORD if this annotation is reached while reading.
        Returns:
        true if eof annotation has been successfully written, false if no space left in internal data buffer
